lines.text: The greatest tragedy in the world, because it is the most frequent, is that of a human soul caught in the toils of the commonplace. This happens in many homes where family ties, which could be bonds of love, have become iron fetters of dependence.
If you want to know what kind of family lives in a house look at the dining room.
Oh, Dwightie, have I kept you waiting?
After twenty years of being married to you, my darling, I aught to be used to waiting.
